data.text: #WashingtonFire (#Jamestown/#Sonora, Tuolumne Co) - There is now an evacuation map online for this area, can be viewed @ https://t.co/H3vqxylA8F https://t.co/xUTSyUACVg

entity.name: Cal Fire lifts Red Flag Warnings across the state of California
entity.description: According to Cal Fire, nearly 5,000 firefighters are battling 22 wildfires in California. "Seasonable weather conditions will persist across California today, as Red Flag Warnings have expired," the department announced on Wednesday. On October 27, firefighters responded to 23 new wildfires and all were contained despite Red Flag Warning conditions.

entity.name: Large fires continue to rage in New Mexico
entity.description: Strong, gusty winds that fueled The Calf Canyon/Hermits Peak fire in New Mexico are expected to pick up by Tuesday afternoon and hot, dry and windy weather will continue through Thursday, per The National Weather Service in Albuquerque. The fire started over a month ago and threatened communities east of Santa Fe. Last week, The Washington Post reported that more than 243,000 acres have already burned in New Mexico alone this year. On May 4, President Joe Biden declared the wildfires a major disaster and ordered federal aid to supplement state and local recovery efforts in affected areas.

tweets.text: #WashingtonFire (#Jamestown/#Sonora, Tuolumne Co) - Not much updates on this one in the last 45 mins, AA440 just continued the no-divert status on 2 tankers due to life threat. Evacuation info below from TCSO Facebook @ https://t.co/Eyr8sa8NtU https://t.co/npfgnE0Mq0
